We are hurdling towards a doctor shortage of 120,000 in this country, and 3,000 in New Jersey. I appreciate Sheriff Cureton's leadership on this issue in our community by taking a holistic approach, involving mental health professionals as well as stopping the illegal sale of opioids in our streets.

We've now seen three senseless mass shootings in the past week: Gilroy, El Paso, and Dayton.

My heart is breaking for those in El Paso who were senselessly killed and injured this afternoon. I'm very grateful for the first responders who are currently responding to this devastating attack on their community. We must not give up our fight for commonsense reforms.
